title: Enclosed charge - cylinder and rho is c-r-squared

content.question: The solid cylinder shown in the figure has radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, and a nonuniform charge density <math alttext="rho" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ρ</mi></math> given by <math alttext="rho of lowercase r equals, c times lowercase r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ρ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is the distance from the cylinder’s central axis and <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math> is a positive constant. What fraction of the cylinder’s total net charge is contained within the region <math alttext="lowercase r is less than or equal to the fraction uppercase R over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
